message_1: In how many ways can you choose 3 letters from the word "MATHS"?
message_2:
To choose 3 letters from the word "MATHS", which has 5 distinct letters, you can use the combination formula:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of items (in this case, 5) and k is the number of items you want to choose (in this case, 3).

C(5, 3) = 5! / (3!(5-3)!)
= 5! / (3!2!)
= (5 × 4 × 3 × 2 × 1) / ((3 × 2 × 1)(2 × 1))
= (5 × 4) / (2 × 1)
= 10

So, there are 10 ways to choose 3 letters from the word "MATHS".
